file_content.text: I've got scouts everywhere now. House Thul won't sneak anything by us again.
Welcome back. All transmissions from the tower stopped. You must have found House Thul's intel.
The Empire would have wiped us out if you hadn't come along. We owe you our lives. Thanks.
Get inside the Imperial base, destroy their intel on us, and shut down that tower.
Welcome to Glarus Valley. Captain Cahill was smart to recruit a whole squad.
Master Jedi, am I glad to see you. Things are even worse than we thought.
Lieutenant. Captain Cahill told me support was on the way. Sure glad it's you.
You're the mercenary Captain Cahill hired. I hope your contract was flexible.
Captain Cahill mentioned Thul agents were seen near one of our weather towers. We caught a few on their way back.
Turns out they weren't sabotaging the tower-- they were converting it for surveillance. House Thul is spying on us.
That's quite a surprise.
We only just found out ourselves. I can't get through to Captain Cahill.
What do you mean?
They could be lying.
They weren't lying. We picked up some transmissions from the tower itself.
That tower used to scan our weather patterns. Now it's scanning our numbers, our equipment, our positions.
Worse, that intel isn't being sent to some remote Thul outpost. It's going to a fully manned Imperial base.
Let's not waste time.
Any more good news?
It's not hopeless. We know they're watching us now. And we've got you.
You let it happen.
House Thul slipped this one by us, it's true. But they won't get away with it.
I've barely got enough troops to defend this outpost, let alone take on the Empire. But you might stand a chance.
Get inside the base, destroy their intel, and shut down the tower. My men can repair it after the dust settles.
No problem.
You'll get a hero's welcome from me, if you can pull this off.
Understood.
They'd better.
Don't worry about us. House Thul won't get past us again.
We'll keep monitoring the tower. Good luck in there.
Sorry, can't talk now. Things are pretty busy here.
